            Postdoctoral Research Fellow
            
            University of Florida
            
            My main interests are how major developmental transitions
            like puberty affect health outcomes and identity
            development. A central aim of my research is to better
            understand why some individuals navigate transitions that
            everyone goes through in their lives more adaptively than
            others. I use a variety of methods in my research, including
            surveys, interviewing, diaries, computational text analysis,
            content coding, and structural equation modeling.
            In my current position, I am working with Drs. Susan
            Bluck and Carma Bylund on an NIH-funded grant to analyze
            narrative mechanisms that may help individuals navigate the
            end of life. I hope to translate the methods I have acquired
            in my postdoc to research that improves parent-child
            communication in conversations about puberty and,
            subsequently, mental health outcomes for youth.
            During my PhD research with Dr. Jane Mendle, much of my work
            focused on understanding how girls make meaning out of
            change during puberty and which aspects of puberty are most
            distressing through a blend of content coding, topic
            modeling, and structural equation modeling.
            
            
            
            
            Research Interests
            Developmental Transitions
            Adolescent Development
            Narrative Identity
            Psychology of Puberty
            Computational Text Analysis
            
            
            Education
            
            PhD in
            Developmental Psychology, 2022 Cornell University
            
            
            MA in
            Developmental Psychology, 2018 Cornell University
            
            
            BA in Psychology
            & History, 2015 Gonzaga University

articles.title: News
articles.contents:
UF Child & Family Blog
Wrote a blog post about what parents might expect their daughters to experience during puberty.
https://childandfamilyblog.com/what-is-puberty-like-for-girls/
 UF Postdoc Summer Series Featured Speaker
 Recognized as rising star at UF during national postdoc appreciation week https://news.ufl.edu/2022/09/postdoc-appreciation-week/
 Featured grad student at Cornell https://gradschool.cornell.edu/spotlights/student-spotlight-mary-kate-koch/
 UF Child & Family Blog
Wrote a blog post about the benefits of writing about puberty for youth.
https://pryde.bctr.cornell.edu/blog/2018/3/22/writing-and-sharing-writing-to-cope-with-pubertys-changes

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Peer-Reviewed Publications
Conference Presentations



Overview
I research how major developmental transitions like puberty affect health outcomes and identity development.
A central aim of my research is to better understand why some individuals navigate transitions that everyone goes through in their lives more adaptively than others.
I use a variety of methods in my research, including surveys, interviewing, diaries, computational text analysis, content coding, and structural equation modeling.
Feel free to email me if there is any project listed here that you would like to know more about.
Peer-Reviewed Publications
Recent Publications
+ Garavito, D. M. N., & Koch, M. K. (2023). Coming of age in the eyes of the law: The conflict between Miranda, J.D.B., and puberty. American Criminal Law Review. https://heinonline.org/HOL/LandingPage?handle=hein.journals/amcrimlr60&div=5&id=&page=
Koch, M. K., & Wang, Q. (2022) Autobiographical memory. In Levesque (Ed.), Encyclopedia of Adolescence. Springer. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-319-32132-5_827-1
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2022). In their own words: Finding meaning in girls’ experiences of puberty. Child Development. https://doi.org/10.1111/cdev.13836
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2021). Real world skills in a virtual world: An innovative activity for teaching developmental psychopathology. Teaching of Psychology. https://doi.org/10.1177/00986283211042309
Koch, M. K., Mendle, J., & Beam, C. R. (2020) Psychological distress amid change: Role disruption in girls during the adolescent transition. Research on Child and Adolescent Psychopathology, 48, 1211-1222. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10802-020-00667-y
Mendle, J., Beam, C. R., McKone, K. M. P., & Koch, M. K. (2020). Puberty and transdiagnostic risks for mental health. Journal of Research on Adolescence, 30, 687 705. https://doi.org/10.1111/jora.12552
Mendle, J., & Koch, M. K. (2019). The psychology of puberty: What aren’t we studying that we should? Child Development Perspectives, 13, 166-172. https://doi.org/10.1111/cdep.12333
McGuire, T. G., McCormick, K. C., Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2019). Pubertal maturation and longitudinal trajectories of depression during early adolescence. Frontiers in Psychology. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2019.01362
Under Review
Koch, M. K., Burd, K. & Mendle, J. Same crime, same time? Effects of visual maturity on juvenile justice decision-making. (Under Review).
Porcelli, S., Mendle, J., & Koch, M. K. Mood-based impulsivity and adolescent relationships: Negative urgency predicts interpersonal problems in youth. (Under Review).
Dissertation
Koch, M. K. (2022) In Whose Words? Experiences at Puberty Situated in Individual, Social, and Cultural Contexts (Publication No. 29161467) [Doctoral dissertation, Cornell University]. ProQuest Dissertations & Theses Global. Available here.
Conference Presentations
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2022. March). Anger or an Accident? Differences in Explanations of Adolescents’ Behavior in Ambiguous Legal Scenarios by Sex x Race x Maturation. Poster presented at the 2022 Biennial Meeting of the Society for Research on Adolescence. New Orleans, LA.
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2021. April). Text analysis of puberty experiences from retrospective and concurrent perspectives. Paper presented at the 2021 Biennial Meeting of the Society for Research in Child Development, Virtual.
Porcelli, S., Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2021. April). Untangling rumination and negative urgency: An exploration of emotional cascade theory in adolescents. Poster presented at the 2021 Biennial Meeting of the Society for Research in Child Development, Virtual.
Kubi, G., Koch, M. K., Ratner, K., & Mendle, J. (2021, March). Perfect fit, or perfectly fixed?: Identity’s role in anxiety and perfectionism. Poster presented at the Society for Research on Adolescence. Virtual.
Porcelli, S., Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2019, May). Negative urgency and interpersonal conflict: The mediating role of depressive symptoms. Poster presented at the 31st APS Annual Convention. Washington, DC.
Koch, M. K., Kubi, G., & Mendle, J. (2019, March). Text analysis approaches to predicting depression in early adolescent girls. Poster presented at the Society for Research on Child Development. Baltimore, MD.
Rosenthal, E., Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2019, March). Is age just a number? Exploring the association among relative age, pubertal timing, and depression. Poster presented at the Society for Research on Child Development. Baltimore, MD.
Koch, M. K., Royer, C., & Mendle, J. (2019, March). Same time, same crime? Pubertal maturation and juvenile sentencing. Paper presented at the American Psychology and Law Society Annual Meeting Portland, OR.
Koch, M. K., McKone, K. M. P., & Mendle, J. (2018, April). The pubertal transition and perceived role disruption. Poster presented at the Society for Research on Adolescence. Minneapolis, MN.
Rosenthal, E., Koch, M. K., Ratner, K., & Mendle, J. (2018, January). ADHD and identity: Situational influences and individual variability. Poster presented at the Society for Social Psychology and Personality. Atlanta, GA.
Wagner, D., Barry, S., Koch, M. K., Dukhovny, D., Koskela, N., Hood, K., & Harris, M. (2017, June). Show them the money! Neglecting the economic value of behavioral health for youth with T1D. Poster presented at the American Diabetes Association Scientific Sessions. San Diego, CA.
Koch, M. K., & Koch, C. (2015, November). Examining the relationship between multi-tasking and working memory. Poster presented at the Psychonomic Society Meeting. Chicago, IL.
Koch, M. K., & Medina, A. (2015, April). Neuroticism, dysphoria, and autobiographical writing style. Poster presented at the Western Psychology Conference for Undergraduate Research. Moraga, CA.
Jasper, L., Koch, C. & Koch, M. K. (2013, August). Impact of substance abuse on everyday memory and attention. Poster presented at the Annual Convention of the American Psychological Association. Honolulu, HI.
Koch, C. & Koch, M. K. (2012, November). Shyness, positive and negative affect, life satisfaction and video games. Poster presented at the Society for Computers in Psychology. Minneapolis, MN.
Jasper, L., Koch, C., & Koch, M. K. (2011, November). The impact of substance abuse on everyday memory and attention. Poster presented at the Object Perception, Attention, & Memory Annual Conference. Seattle, WA.

articles.title: Teaching
articles.contents:
These are some of the classes I have taught as the instructor of record, as well as information about some guest lectures and invited workshops I have done.
Feel free to contact me if you would like information about any of them.
I’ve also published course material in Teaching in Psychology on an interactive class summit activity. I developed the activity for a course on Developmental Psychopathology, but the format can be broadly adapted to other courses. These materials are freely available on OSF.
Undergraduate Courses
Adolescence and Emerging Adulthood (Lecture) at Cornell University
Unequal Childhoods (Freshmen writing seminar) at Cornell University
Narratives of Women’s Live (Combined lecture/seminar) at Cornell University
Guest Lectures
Lecture on depression in Developmental Psychopathology at Cornell University
Lecture on the psychology of puberty in Adolescence and Emerging Adulthood at Cornell University
Lecture on end-of-life decision-making in Aging and Adulthood at Cornell University
Workshops
Text mining tools for narrative analysis and other mixed-method research (SSEA 2021)
Topic modeling for psychologists
Interactional analyses: Empathic Communication
Content coding: Communion
